title: ‘They Eat Like Teenagers’: Why the Giro d’Italia Peloton Gets to Skip Their Greens before Mountain Stages
content:
How a 'low-fiber, low-residue' diet allows riders to ditch fruit and veggies to stay lean and mean for the hardest stages of the Giro d'Italia.

Read the full article at ‘They Eat Like Teenagers’: Why the Giro d’Italia Peloton Gets to Skip Their Greens before Mountain Stages on Velo.
author: Jim Cotton
